sections.title: Introduction to HTML
sections.content: Learn the basics of HTML (Hypertext Markup Language), including tags, elements, and document structure. Understand how HTML is used to create the structure of web pages.
sections.activity: Create a simple personal webpage with headings, paragraphs, lists, and links using HTML.

sections.title: Styling with CSS
sections.content: Explore Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) and how they're used to style HTML elements. Learn about selectors, properties, and values.
sections.activity: Add CSS to your personal webpage to change colors, fonts, and layout. Experiment with different styles and responsive design.

sections.title: JavaScript fundamentals
sections.content: Introduction to JavaScript as a client-side scripting language. Learn about variables, functions, and basic DOM manipulation.
sections.activity: Add interactivity to your webpage with JavaScript, such as a button that changes text when clicked or a simple form validation.

sections.title: Responsive design principles
sections.content: Understand the importance of responsive design and how to create websites that work well on various devices and screen sizes.
sections.activity: Modify your personal webpage to be responsive, using CSS media queries and flexible layouts.

sections.title: Web accessibility basics
sections.content: Learn about web accessibility and why it's important. Explore techniques for making web content more accessible to people with disabilities.
sections.activity: Audit your personal webpage for accessibility issues and make improvements, such as adding alt text to images and ensuring proper color contrast.
